column4: find the real libncurses.so file and then create a link to libncurses.so.5 using the main file.
okay, ill do a search
I found the file with a search... what do i do with it though? and by the way there's like 3... libncurses.so.5.5, libncurses.so.5, and another libncurses.so.5
what directory are they in? and what are you trying to build.
im not trying to build anything. i installed peerguardian, and its saying that libncurses.so.5 cannot be found
put it in the peerguardian path? as in copy it to the same directory?
Im so confused >.< i just wanna block aggressive ips here
heh, that caused a segmentation fault
I still say the deb package's i368 label may be to blame, seeing as im in a 64 bit platform here
peerguardian is working for me. have you tried moblock?
yes, and it installs, but its log file is totally static.
i dont really know if its actually doing anything
check /etc/moblock/guarding.p2p or check the cron jobs.
WOAH.  /etc/moblock/guarding.p2p has oen big list
if i try to ping one of these, i should be blocked right?
not sure, all i know is you block them. but it sounds reasonable that it would be blocked.
so... moblock is working then? :/
sounds like it :)

look for moblock in /etc/cron.daily
